Return: {"skills":["..."],"experience_years":<int>,"education":"Bachelor's Degree|Master's Degree|PhD|Diploma|High School|Not Specified"}
llm_response:
```python
import re
import json

# Define the regular expression patterns to match the required information
skills_pattern = r"Languages (.*?)\n|Frameworks (.*?)\n|Databases (.*?)\n|Tools (.*?)\n|Concepts (.*?)\n"
experience_pattern = r"(\d{4}–\d{4})Python Developer,(.*?)\n(.*?)○([^\n]+)\n○([^\n]+)\n○([^\n]+)\n○([^\n]+)\n"
education_pattern = r"(\d{4}–\d{4})Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science,(.*?)\nGraduated with(.*?)\n"
certifications_pattern = r"(\d{4}) (.*?)\n"

# Define the function to extract information from the resume
def extract_info(resume):
    # Extract skills
    skills = re.findall(skills_pattern, resume, re.DOTALL)
    skills = [skill.strip() for sublist in skills for skill in sublist if skill]
    skills = [skill for sublist in skills for skill in sublist.split('\n') if skill and skill.strip()]

    # Extract experience
    experience = re.findall(experience_pattern, resume, re.DOTALL)
    experience = [(year, role, company, skill1, skill2, skill3, skill4) for year, role, company, skill1, skill2, skill3, skill4 in experience]

    # Extract education
    education = re.findall(education_pattern, resume, re.DOTALL)
    education = [(year, degree, institution, honours) for year, degree, institution, honours in education]

    # Extract certifications
    certifications = re.findall(certifications_pattern, resume, re.DOTALL)
    certifications = [(year, course) for year, course in certifications]

    # Return the extracted information as a dictionary
    return {
        "skills": skills,
        "experience_years": len(experience),
        "education": "Bachelor's Degree" if len(education) > 0 else "Not Specified"
    }

# Read the resume from the console
resume = input("Enter the resume: ")

# Extract information from the resume and print the result as JSON
print(json.dumps(extract_info(resume)))
```

You can copy and paste the code and run it in your Python environment. It will prompt you to enter the resume, and then it will print the extracted information as a JSON object.
